member.exception: A with the provided and has already been registered.

summary.para: Use these rules to cache commonly resolved dependencies, speeding up Scene load times. We use this whitelist approach because caching ALL dependency resolutions could use up significant memory, and could actually worsen performance if many of the dependencies were only to be resolved by one client.

After a class instance with one of these types has had its dependences resolved via reflection, the reflected metadata and matching services will be cached, so that subsequent clients of the same type will have their dependencies injected much faster. This is useful if you know you will have many client components in a scene with the same type.

member.summary: Gets/sets the number of times that each service has been resolved at runtime.

member.name: T:UnityUtil.Logging.BaseUnityUtilLogger`1
member.summary: Base class for custom loggers in components. Derived types can define methods that provide statically-typed parameters to specific log messages and abstract away their log levels and other log properties.
member.typeparam: The type that is logging. It's type name will be appended as the "category" of all its log messages.
member.remarks:
Defining all log messages in a single class means that developers only have to look within a single type to find log conflicts, inconsistent log property names, inconsistent language/grammar, etc. It also provides a single type to modify when migrating log frameworks (though this is less of an issue with the namespace).
Each method of a derived class should be referenced by at most one call site; if a method is no longer referenced then it should be deleted, effectively deleting its inner log message.
Every log message must have a unique integer ID, so that specific messages can be searched in log files and storage systems. This means that all log events are sharing the same "space" of event IDs, both within components of the namespaces, and the components of your own application. To prevent conflicts, we divide this space into six "subspaces" or "ranges" for each , with 100,000,000 unique IDs each.
These ID ranges are:
Log level ID Range Start ID Range End
0 99,999,999
100,000,000 199,999,999
200,000,000 299,999,999
300,000,000 399,999,999
400,000,000 499,999,999
500,000,000 599,999,999
Each namespace of , then, is given 1,000 unique event IDs to work with in each -subspace (by default), starting from some "base offset". For example, the event ID offset of the root namespace is 0, so it can use information event IDs 200,000,000 - 200,000,999 and warning event IDs 300,000,000 - 300,000,999. Likewise, if the event ID offset of another namespace is 1000, then it can use information event IDs 200,001,000 - 200,001,999 and warning event IDs 300,001,000 - 300,001,999. In other words, a namespace's event ID offset sets the lowest offset relative to the start of each -range that a namespace can use.
The authoritative list of namespace event ID offsets is maintained in the UnityUtil repo. You must avoid using event IDs that collide with these ranges when creating new log messages in libraries that reference , so that you don't pass these conflicts on to consumers. If you are only referencing in an application, then you should still avoid ID collisions; ID collisions will not break your application's logging, but they will make it more difficult to search for specific logs.
Note to Inheritors
Inheriting from this class will make all of the above ID-management easier. The constructor accepts an offset parameter, and your custom log methods can use it by calling the meethod. That way, your custom log methods can all use simple monotonically increasing event IDs (0, 1, 2, etc.), and the actual integer value is computed (- and namespace-offsets added) in one place.
By convention, the custom logger for each namespace is a class called <Namespace>Logger within that namespace. See the namespaces in this repo for examples.
When using dependency injection, consumers should not inject this class or any of its derived types directly. Instead, consumers should inject and new up these types in-situ explicitly. Otherwise, the recommendation would be to create an interface for the custom logger and an implementing type, and that would just create a lot of friction when adding a new log message.

member.name: T:UnityUtil.Math.IRandomishOptionChooser
member.summary: Chooses between options in a "randomish" way, i.e., a way that feels random to humans over time but may not be truly (psuedo)random.

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Math.IRandomishOptionChooser.GetOptionIndex
member.summary: Chooses an option index in a "randomish" way, i.e., a way that feels random to humans over time but may not be truly (psuedo)random.
member.returns: An index between 0 (inclusive) and the number of options (exclusive).

summary.para: Chooses between options in a "randomish" way, i.e., a way that feels random to humans over time but is not truly random. Achieved by repeating options some max number of times in a row.
This type is not thread safe. If randomish option indices must be accessed by multiple threads, you will need to implement your own synchronization mechanism.

member.name: F:UnityUtil.Math.MaxRepeatsRandomishOptionChooser.ProbabilitySumTolerance
member.summary: All must sum to 1, within this tolerance. This accounts for probabilities that cannot be accurately represented with floating point numbers (e.g., 1/9).

member.name: P:UnityUtil.Math.MaxRepeatsRandomishOptionChooser.OptionRepeats
member.summary: Number of times the option at each index has been repeated during the last calls to .

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Math.MaxRepeatsRandomishOptionChooser.GetOptionIndex
member.summary: Chooses an option index using "randomish" logic. This is an O(n) operation, where n is the number of options.
member.returns: An index between 0 (inclusive) and the number of options (exclusive).

remarks.para: Indices are chosen using the configured while ensuring that no option is returned more than times in a row. For example, suppose [0.3, 0.4, 0.3] are the specified probabilities, with a max repeat of 3. Initially, there is a 30% chance of returning 0, 40% chance of returning 1, and 30% chance of returning 2. If index 1 is returned 3 times in a row, then on the next call, there will instead be a 50% chance of returning 0 and a 50% chance of returning 2 (maintaining the relative probabilities of those options, while preventing 1 from being returned again). On the next call, index 1 has no longer been returned 3 times in a row, so the probabilties go back to their initial values.
To understand this method's logic, picture a set of ranges between 0 and 1, with sizes determined by the .

The caret represents a random value, R, between 0 and 1 (inclusive). The probability of choosing option i (0-based), according to the specified probabilities, equals the probability of R falling within the (i+1)th range (where each range includes its left bound). E.g., the probability of choosing index 1 equals the probability of R falling within the 2nd range. Therefore, the index at which the cumulative probability of is greater than R is the "chosen" index.

maintains a collection of the last indices returned. When an option has been chosen more than the max allowed times in a row, its probability is temporarily zero. In the above visualization, this is equivalent to collapsing that option's interval to zero width, and then restricting R to the range between 0 and (1 - that option's probability).

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Math.MaxRepeatsRandomishOptionChooser.UseOption(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjust state after the option at is chosen.
member.param: Index of the option that was chosen.
member.exception: is out of bounds of the list.
Option at has already been repeated the max of times in a row.

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Math.MoreMath.RandomWeightedIndex(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Single},UnityUtil.Math.IRandomAdapter)
member.summary: Gets a random index where each index has a provided weight. For example, if [0.3, 0.4, 0.3] is provided, then there is a 30% chance of returning 0, 40% chance of returning 1, and 30% chance of returning 2.
member.param: The weights for each index. These must sum up to 1.
The object used to generate pseudorandom numbers.
member.returns: An index between 0 (inclusive) and the length of (exclusive)
member.exception: is empty.
The sum of is not 1.
member.remarks:
Picture a set of ranges between 0 and 1, with sizes determined by
|-------|----------------------|---|--------| |------------------^------------------------|
The caret represents a random value, R, between 0 and 1 (inclusive). The probability of choosing index i (0-based), according to the specified weights, equals the probability of R falling within the (i+1)th range (where each range includes its left bound). E.g., the probability of choosing index 1 equals the probability of R falling within the 2nd range. Therefore, the index at which the cumulative probability of is greater than R is our "chosen" index.

member.summary: Returns a random unit vector within a cone of the provided half-angle around the provided 's forward vector (uniformly distributed).
member.param: The around whose forward vector the cone is centered
The half angle (in degrees) of the cone
If , then the random unit vector will be constrained to the boundary of the cone. If , then the random unit vector may be anywhere within the cone.
member.returns: A random unit vector within a cone of the provided half-angle around the provided 's forward vector (uniformly distributed).
member.exception: is less then 0 or greater than or equal to 360.

member.name: P:UnityUtil.Math.UniformBatchedRandomishOptionChooserConfig.OptionCount
member.summary: Number of equally likely options that can be chosen. Must be 1 or greater.

member.name: P:UnityUtil.Math.UniformBatchedRandomishOptionChooserConfig.MinRunsPerBatch
member.summary: Minimum number of runs (sequences of repeated options) allowed per batch. Must be 0 or greater and less than .

member.name: P:UnityUtil.Math.UniformBatchedRandomishOptionChooserConfig.MaxRunsPerBatch
member.summary: Maximum number of runs (sequences of repeated options) allowed per batch. Must be greater than or equal to .

member.name: P:UnityUtil.Math.UniformBatchedRandomishOptionChooserConfig.MaxRepeatsPerRun
member.summary: Maximum number of times an option can be repeated in a run, i.e., the max "length" of a run. Minimum number of repeats per run is obviously 1, so must be greater than 1.

summary.para: Chooses between options in a "randomish" way, i.e., a way that feels random to humans over time but is not truly random. Achieved by generating "batches" of options in advance with configurable numbers/lengths of runs. All options are assumbed to be equally likely; they will have a "uniform" distribution over time.
This type is not thread safe. If randomish option indices must be accessed by multiple threads, you will need to implement your own synchronization mechanism.

member.name: P:UnityUtil.Math.UniformBatchedRandomishOptionChooser.BatchProviderDelegate
member.summary: The delegate that will provide the next batch of option indices. Defaults to . This property should only be explicitly set in unit tests!

member.name: F:UnityUtil.Math.UniformBatchedRandomishOptionChooser.LastOptionIndexOfPreviousBatch
member.summary: will ensure that this index is not chosen at the start of a batch, to prevent accidentally "continuing" a run across batches. This property should only be explicitly set in unit tests!

member.name: T:UnityUtil.ShowBackingFieldAttribute
member.summary:
Force Unity to serialize the backing field of a C# auto-implemented property. Consuming properties should be declared as follows (note that both a getter and a setter are required for Unity to recognize the backing field):
[field: SerializeBackingField] public SomeType SomeProperty { get; private set; }

member.summary: Spawned instances will be launched along the 's forward vector.

member.name: F:UnityUtil.SpawnDirection.ConeRandom
member.summary: Spawned instances will be launched along a random vector within a cone centered around the 's forward vector.

member.name: F:UnityUtil.SpawnDirection.ConeBoundary
member.summary: Spawned instances will be launched along a random vector on the boundary of a cone centered around the 's forward vector.

member.name: F:UnityUtil.SpawnDirection.AnyDirection
member.summary: Spawned instances will be launched along any random vector.

member.name: M:UnityUtil.UnityObjectExtensions.AssertActiveAndEnabled(UnityEngine.Behaviour,System.String)
member.summary: Assert that this component is both active and enabled.
member.param: The to assert as active and enabled

If this component is either inactive or disabled, then this verb will be used in the logged error message. Should be present-tense phrase, like "stop", or "perform that action". Padding spaces are not required.

member.name: T:UnityUtil.Updating.IUnityMainThreadDispatcher
member.summary: Original author: Pim de Witte (pimdewitte.com) and contributors, https://github.com/PimDeWitte/UnityMainThreadDispatcher. Encapsulates a thread-safe queue with actions to execute on the next update loop. It can be used to make calls to Unity's main thread for things such as UI manipulation. It was developed for use in combination with the Firebase Unity plugin, which uses separate threads for event handling.

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.IUnityMainThreadDispatcher.Enqueue(System.Action)
member.summary: Locks the queue and adds to the queue
member.param: Action that will be executed from Unity's main thread.

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.IUnityMainThreadDispatcher.EnqueueAsync(System.Action)
member.summary: Locks the queue and adds to the queue, returning a which is completed when the action completes
member.param: Action that will be executed from Unity's main thread.
member.returns: A that can be awaited until the action completes

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.IUpdater.RegisterUpdate(System.Int32,System.Action{System.Single})
member.summary: Register an to be called every frame for the component with a given instance ID.
member.param: The instance ID of the component that will be updated every frame. Must be unique among all registered instances.
The to be called every frame.
member.exception: An Update has already been registered for .

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.IUpdater.UnregisterUpdate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Unregister an from being called every frame for the component with the specified instance ID.
member.param: The instance ID of the component that no longer needs to be updated every frame. Must have been previously registered with .
member.exception: No Update was ever registered for .

member.param: The instance ID of the component that will be updated every physics frame. Must be unique among all registered instances.
The to be called every physics frame.
member.exception: A FixedUpdate has already been registered for .

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.IUpdater.UnregisterFixedUpdate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Unregister an from being called every physics frame for the component with the specified instance ID.
member.param: The instance ID of the component that no longer needs to be updated every physics frame. Must have been previously registered with .
member.exception: No FixedUpdate was ever registered for .

member.param: The instance ID of the component that will be updated at the end of every frame. Must be unique among all registered instances.
The to be called at the end of every frame.
member.exception: A LateUpdate has already been registered for .

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.IUpdater.UnregisterLateUpdate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Unregister an from being called at the end of every frame for the component with the specified instance ID.
member.param: The instance ID of the component that no longer needs to be updated at the end of every frame. Must have been previously registered with .
member.exception: No LateUpdate was ever registered for .

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.IUpdater.TrimStorage
member.summary: Sets the capacity of all underlying collections to the actual number of elements in those collections. Depending on implementation, there may be separate collections for Update actions, FixedUpdate actions, etc., the memory of which are all auto-allocated as more actions are added. Trimming the capacity of these collections is thus an important way of saving memory, e.g., after several updatable objects have been destroyed.

member.name: T:UnityUtil.Updating.UnityMainThreadDispatcher
member.summary: Original author: Pim de Witte (pimdewitte.com) and contributors, https://github.com/PimDeWitte/UnityMainThreadDispatcher. A thread-safe class which holds a queue with actions to execute on the next update loop. It can be used to make calls to Unity's main thread for things such as UI manipulation. It was developed for use in combination with the Firebase Unity plugin, which uses separate threads for event handling.

member.name: T:UnityUtil.Updating.Updatable
member.summary: Base class for components that need to register with the UnityUtil update system.

member.name: P:UnityUtil.Updating.Updatable.InstanceId
member.summary: Runtime instance ID of this component, used internally to register actions with the update system. Inheritors may use this value so they don't have to add duplicate dependencies on an .

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.Updatable.RegisterUpdate(System.Action{System.Single})
member.summary: Register to be called during Update. It will automatically be unsubscribed and resubscribed as the component is disabled (or destroyed) and re-enabled.
member.param: The action to be called during Update

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.Updatable.RegisterFixedUpdate(System.Action{System.Single})
member.summary: Register to be called during FixedUpdate. It will automatically be unsubscribed and resubscribed as the component is disabled (or destroyed) and re-enabled.
member.param: The action to be called during FixedUpdate

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.Updatable.RegisterLateUpdate(System.Action{System.Single})
member.summary: Register to be called during LateUpdate. It will automatically be unsubscribed and resubscribed as the component is disabled (or destroyed) and re-enabled.
member.param: The action to be called during LateUpdate

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.Updatable.UnregisterUpdate
member.summary: Unregister this component's Update action.
member.exception: No Update action was ever registered for this component.

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.Updatable.UnregisterFixedUpdate
member.summary: Unregister this component's FixedUpdate action.
member.exception: No FixedUpdate action was ever registered for this component.

member.name: M:UnityUtil.Updating.Updatable.UnregisterLateUpdate
member.summary: Unregister this component's LateUpdate action.
member.exception: No LateUpdate action was ever registered for this component.
